availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Stanford, Kentucky, resident and attorney. Lincoln County native. Married to Mariah Peyton Hill in 1849. Father of Zuritha Hill, Mary Hill, Annie Hill, Alfred Hill, Thomas Hill, Bailey Hill, and Fannie Hill. Attended St. Mary’s College in Marion County, Kentucky. Admitted to the bar in 1849. Owned one enslaved person in 1850. Attorney in practice with J. W. Alcorn from 1865 to 1887.

ab.bibl: The Biographical Encyclopædia of Kentucky of the Dead and Living Men of the Nineteenth Century (Cincinnati, OH: J. M. Armstrong and Company, 1878), p. 380. Interior Journal (Stanford, Ky.), March 2, 1909, p. 1. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, Division 1, p. 289. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, Stanford, p. 16. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Lincoln County, Stanford, p. 4. Kentucky Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates, Ancestry, 1931, file no. 27529. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, Division 1, p. 105.
